page.title: 16BRAINS FARM WINCANTON pt 1
page.content: There are about 22 farms in our area. {Mr.Cocks'}farm is on the Blackmore Vale at the Eastern edge of our block. We interviewed him to find the pattern of life on a{dairy}farm in 1985. Mr. Cocks' family bought Brain's Farm in 1959. They then had 20 cows and 18 heifers on 100 acres of land. Today they have 200 acres supporting 100 Friesian cows, 60 replacement heifers and some bull beef as a sideline. Their bull calves go to{F.M.C.}at {Salisbury}for slaughter and are then supplied to Tescos. The cows go to abbatoirs at{Martock}and are exported to{France.}Their surplus calves go to {Sturminster Newton Market}and are sold for export to Holland and Belgium. He has a herringbone{milking parlour and milks the cows at 6.30 a.m. and at 4.30 p.m. The process is semi- automatic. cont
